intro: Bersama nyassae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The flowers are usually borne on short stalks and can last for several weeks.
